html.p: Theorem. Let [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] be an [mathjaxinline]m\times n[/mathjaxinline] matrix and let [mathjaxinline]v\in \mathbb R^ m[/mathjaxinline]. Then the equation [mathjaxinline]A^ t Ax = A^ t v[/mathjaxinline] is consistent, and any of its solutions will be a least-squares solution to the equation [mathjaxinline]Ax = v[/mathjaxinline].
